toggle.heading: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: Best National University Rankings
hero.description: Schools in the National Universities category, such as the University of Chicago and Carnegie Mellon University, offer a full range of undergraduate majors, plus master's and doctoral programs. These colleges also are committed to producing groundbreaking research.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

items.blurb: Founded in 1890, Texas Wesleyan University is a private institution. Texas Wesleyan University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1901, Texas Woman's University is a public institution. The school has 43.5% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Texas Woman's University is 19:1.
Founded in 1901, Trevecca Nazarene University is a private institution.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

items.blurb: Founded in 1972, Universidad Ana G. Mendez--Gurabo Campus is a private institution.

Students at the University of Akron can hang out in the Starbucks café or Barnes & Noble bookstore in the Student Union building, float along the lazy river in the recreation center or try out for the nearly 20 Division I sports teams. Notable UA alumni include former NFL players Charlie Frye and Jason Taylor, and actress Yvette Nicole Brown, who starred in the television show "Community."

items.blurb: A private, seaside school in Connecticut, the University of Bridgeport offers many clubs, Greek organizations and sports on campus, as well as parks and a zoo nearby. Famous former students include the 7-foot-7 NBA player Manute Bol and Subway restaurant co-founder Fred DeLuca.

utag_data.stitial_fact: There are more than 2,900 four-year, degree-granting postsecondary institutions in the U.S.
